caption:
This photograph shows an industrial or technical setting, possibly inside a laboratory or testing facility, where two men are engaged in what appears to be an engineering or mechanical task. 

In the foreground, there's a man on the left side of the image squatting beside a complex machinery setup. He is holding an instrument or device, focused intently on interacting with a section of pipework that carries several sensor attachments and potentially measurement devices. He is dressed in a light-gray lab coat, suggesting a professional or technical environment.

To the right, another man is standing, handling a handheld device connected to a long flexible tube, seemingly associated with the machine's operation. He wears a casual blue blazer and light-yellow shirt, indicating a less formal role or perhaps a different type of professional involvement than the first man. His expression and stance also suggest concentration or involvement with his task.

The machinery that dominates the center of the image is a large, robust-looking engine or pump painted yellow, indicating heavy-duty use. This machinery is outfitted with various pipes and valves, indicating its function involves fluid or gas processing.

The background is simple, featuring light-blue walls which contrast with the industrial equipment. This setting appears designed for functionality rather than aesthetics, with practical lighting and a focus on accessibility and maintenance of the equipment.

Overall, the composition of the photo highlights a moment of professional activity and technical engagement, characterized by the use of specialized equipment and attentive handling by the participants.
title: Evaluation and development control room at EPA's Ann Arbor motor vehicle emissions test center
